intro: Eruca glabrescens var. valverdensis, commonly known as the Norwegian wallcress, is a flowering plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many edible and ornamental plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in early spring, and it produces slender, edible pods similar to those of other mustard species. This variety is valued for its hardy nature and potential use in both culinary and horticultural contexts.
